“I think abortion should be restricted to certain circumstances, such as cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is at risk. This approach balances the rights of the unborn with the needs of women facing difficult situations. Society should provide support for women who carry their pregnancies to term, including healthcare and financial assistance.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I partially agree with this statement. I can agree that there should be restrictions, but I don't think we should be specifying cases. Again, we are not the ones that will be raising this child, so why should we have a say so in their life? It shouldn't even be up to the government to provide resources if the woman chooses to have the child. Those are going to be our tax dollars, so again, why should my money be going towards a child I didn't help create or bring into this world? The decision to keep or not keep belongs to the pregnant woman. Her body, her life, her responsibility. I can't tell anyone what to do with their body, an unborn child having more rights than the life that unborn child needs to be created, is insane to me. Women are treated as baby making machines, no one ever considers the health and wellness of the mother.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with this statement more than the last two. I agree that it should be legal because it is the woman's right to have autonomy over their body. No many or agency should be dictating what anyone does with their body. I agree that sex education and contraception is the better solution than to ban abortions. Women are blamed for needing or getting an abortion, as if a man didn't help them create the child. Men are often relieved and forgiven of their parental responsibility, that's always put on the mom ,and that's unfair. There are too many men out there lying about using a condom, not wanting to use a condom, or just not liking safe sex. Safe sex education should be encouraged so that people want to make smarter decisions like preventing pregnancy over aborting it.

question_text:

text: I agree it should be legal, but with restrictions on the time frame. There has always been a certain time frame in which you can get an abortion, and for good reason.  Once you're too far along and the baby is more developed into a whole human, then I think that is unethical to abort so late. Society needs to put more responsibility on the men as well as the women. More education should be provided to young men about the risks of unprotected sex, the risks of multiple pregnancies, the risks of abortions. The education needs to also be put on the man. Women have always had this fear instilled in them to not get pregnant or be safe, etc, but men get to live carefree like they don't partially help create said life.

text: I agree with this statement. This is a very personal decision that only a woman can make, and her doctor absolutely should be involved and given her the best advice for HER, not advice based on their personal beliefs. Affordable healthcare and reproductive services should be accessible for all women. THere's no reason giving birth or requesting services outside of the annual exam timeframe should cost so much money.

"Society should support comprehensive sex education and contraception to reduce the need for abortions.”  What age and exactly what are you going to "educate" these kids on?

We don't need people coming in and brainwashing kids about what gender/sex they are. They can make that decision at 18 when they can LEGALLY change it. Kids are too young and stupid to make permanent life decisions like that.

Your Position

text: I personally do not think abortion should be a viable option in almost every case. I will concede that for political reasons it would not be completely fair to society to impose my opinion to it's fullest extent. I'm willing to be comfortable with and understanding that some allowances should be in place. It should not be an easy decision and needs to be something that everyone understands the full weight and consequences of.

Part 3/3: Candidate Summaries

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we will condense the survey responses into a short summary. We will now present 5 candidate summaries to you, and your task is to rate to what extent they would capture your point of view.

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible because women have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. Access to safe abortions is crucial for protecting women's health and well-being. Society should support comprehensive sex education and contraception to reduce the need for abortions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: The premise that abortion only has to do with women's health is ludicrous. It takes a man and woman to create a child. It is almost as selfish as abortion itself to consider it only as a women's health issue.

question_text:

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I agree with this completely, except that I feel there should be a small sliver in which it is a legal act. I do think adoption should be promoted more and I also think better education and better influences are needed for kids before they can put themselves in a situation where a child is created.

text: Rape and incest make up the reason for abortion in an incredibly small amount of cases. They are always brought up, but given too much weight in creating policy. I do agree that abortion should be limited to only a few small reasons for a short period of time. I do not feel that society needs to bear the burden of what in most cases is a decision that someone else made.

question_text:

text: I do agree that it should be limited to the first trimester. I don't believe there should really be any exception after that time. Again, this has nothing to do with women's rights. That excuse is used to drum up anger amongst those that believe the woman is the central figure and not the child. It's also hypocritical as it takes all responsibility and decision making away from the man, even though if the child were to be born, much of the financial responsibility would be decided in court to be that of the same man.

text: I fully disagree with this statement. Once again, abortion does not involve a woman only and is not a general healthcare topic relating to women's health. It again is selfish and marginalizes the responsibility that falls on the two people it takes to create a baby and completely ignores the rights of a the child.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses. We will award a $1 bonus if your submission satisfies all minimum length requirements across all questions.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Part 1/3: Background Questions

We will begin by asking you 4 questions touching on specific parts of your opinion.

Background Questions

How often do think about abortion or discuss it with others? How does this topic make you feel?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: The majority of times that I think about abortion are when the topic comes up online or in conversation. This is probably about once every two weeks or so. The times that I think about abortion without any instigating stimuli is probably about once every 1-2 months. This topic makes me upset. I am a Christian, and so I am very pro-life and believe that every human life should be cherished, even if that human hasn't been born yet. However, I do believe that if a doctor deems it medically necessary to abort or there will long-lasting effects if a woman does not abort, then it should be allowed. Also, if a psychologist says that a woman was raped and it would be traumatic to carry to term, maybe in that case it would be necessary. But I don't think this should be an option available for just anyone for just any reason. These human beings have a right to life as soon as they are conceived.

question_text:
Background Questions

Do you think abortion should be legal or illegal? Which circumstances does your answer depend on?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think abortion should be mostly illegal. I think the only exceptions should be the ones I discussed in the precious question. So it should be legal in all states, but only under certain circumstances, which I talked about in the previous question.

question_text:
Background Questions

Where do your beliefs about abortion come from? For example, did particular life experiences influence your beliefs?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I grew up Christian, and still believe and follow Jesus today. The Bible talks about the value of human life, and how we are all made in the image of God. So, I grew up believing that every human life matters, as soon as that human life is conceived. I still believe this today.

question_text:
Background Questions

Can you describe a situation where you are not sure if abortion is appropriate or not? If so, what makes this situation borderline or unclear?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Of the 3 circumstances I discussed in the very first question, the one that is not fully clear to me is the one where a woman is raped and it would be traumatic for her to carry the baby to term. It's frustrating because this is not as common as it is made out to be in the media. But for these kinds of cases, I also understand the pain a woman in that situation would be going through, and I do empathize. It's difficult because I also empathize for the human life growing inside her, that I believe should get a chance to live. In my mind, the ideal way to deal with this situation would be for the woman to carry the baby to term while receiving therapy and being given physical, financial, spiritual, and emotional support by either loved ones, or if that's not an option, some kind of fertility center. If the woman decides she doesn't want to raise the child, maybe she can work with an adoption agency or give the child to a couple that can't conceive but would like a child.

question_text:
Part 2/3: Your Position

This part only has one question. We will ask you to summarize, in three sentences, your overall position on abortion.

Your Position

Summarize your position on abortion in your own words. Please write how you think society should deal with abortions, and give reasons that support this policy.

Please write exactly 3 sentences: Be as precise as possible and prioritize the points that are most important to you. Your answer should be self-contained, which means that you can repeat things you already wrote as well as make new points.
text: I believe abortion should be legal in all states, but only allowed in certain circumstances. These circumstances would include: if a doctor deems it medically necessary, if there will be negative long-term effects from not aborting, and if a psychologist deems that a woman would have too much trauma from carrying a baby to term that was conceived as a result of rape. In all other cases, I believe women should approach their sexual lives with intention and responsibility, taking care to prevent outcomes they don't want.

text: I agree with this entire summary. However, I think to make it more concrete, it would need to list out a plan for legality, including any exceptions if this person thinks there should be any.

text: This summary is almost exactly the same as mine, except that I included the exception of "if there would be negative long-term effects from not aborting". I don't think everyone is aware that these risks do exist, and that although they aren't life threatening, they would have serious consequences on the mother's body.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

“I believe that abortion should be allowed in the first trimester but restricted afterward unless there are exceptional circumstances. This policy respects a woman's right to choose while recognizing the increasing moral considerations as the pregnancy progresses. (Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with some of this summary. I don't think a woman should have the right to choose at all, unless she meets one or more of the 3 exceptions I talked about. I see a human's status as a human being starting at conception, not later in the pregnancy. I could never see a human being as "just a clump of cells" as some say. So that part I very strongly disagree with. However, I do appreciate that they talk about the value of human life, and that that human life needs to be considered. I also agree that there should be more infrastructure for education and support given to new mothers, especially that they remain neutral and caring while also valuing the human life these mothers are growing.

question_text:

Access to safe abortions is crucial for protecting women's health and well-being. Society should support comprehensive sex education and contraception to reduce the need for abortions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Like I said for the last summary, I don't think women should have the right to choose. They should have the right to an abortion only if they meet one or more of the 3 exceptions I mentioned. Although I do agree that there should be more detailed sex education and contraception available, I believe women should be more intentional and responsible in their sex lives and should try their, along with their partners, best to avoid an outcome they don't want.

Candidate Summaries

Each situation is unique, and women should have the autonomy to make the best choice for themselves and their families. Society should ensure that all women have access to affordable healthcare, including reproductive services.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: While I agree that it is important that a doctor make the right decisions medically, I think government should be involved. I value human life, even unborn human life too much to give the idea that much freedom.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Abortion comes up a lot in my mind and I discuss it with other people approximately once every three weeks. Sometimes it comes up in conversation more often especially if it's in the news. I sometimes avoid discussing abortion with people I deem close minded or argumentative because it can be a sensitive subject to some.

question_text:
Background Questions

Do you think abortion should be legal or illegal? Which circumstances does your answer depend on?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think abortion should be legal. Being a parent, I know the difficulty that comes with raising children and appreciate that it is not a job for everyone. Medical complications that may put the mother or child's life in peril should warrant a consideration for abortion. I also think personal choice to not become a parent is a good enough reason to opt for abortion. It is my opinion that one would rather abort than bring a child to bad parenting.

question_text:
Background Questions

Where do your beliefs about abortion come from? For example, did particular life experiences influence your beliefs?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: My beliefs come from my experiences around poor parenting and the sorrow I feel whenever I see children suffering through no fault of their own. I also happen to favor logic and facts over belief. This may have been accelerated by my fascination with Phylosophy.

question_text:
Background Questions

Can you describe a situation where you are not sure if abortion is appropriate or not? If so, what makes this situation borderline or unclear?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: A situation where the parents want a child and have the resources to parent the child but there is a medical situation that might put the mother's life in danger would put my stand in doubt. Moreso if there is a slight chance that the child might be born and both mother and child get through it. Another would be if the pregnant mother does not want to be a parent but another person who cannot have a child of their own offers to raise the child

question_text:
Part 2/3: Your Position

This part only has one question. We will ask you to summarize, in three sentences, your overall position on abortion.

Your Position

Summarize your position on abortion in your own words. Please write how you think society should deal with abortions, and give reasons that support this policy.

Please write exactly 3 sentences: Be as precise as possible and prioritize the points that are most important to you. Your answer should be self-contained, which means that you can repeat things you already wrote as well as make new points.
text: I am pro abortion and think that society should approach the topic through fresh eyes. Most people who oppose abortion do so based on their religious beliefs, not basing their stand on hard facts and logical reasoning. Children are a huge and permanent responsibility and winging it while hoping for the best, to me, is not a sensible way to approach such matters.

Part 2/3: Your Position

This part only has one question. We will ask you to summarize, in three sentences, your overall position on abortion.

Your Position

Summarize your position on abortion in your own words. Please write how you think society should deal with abortions, and give reasons that support this policy.

Please write exactly 3 sentences: Be as precise as possible and prioritize the points that are most important to you. Your answer should be self-contained, which means that you can repeat things you already wrote as well as make new points.
text: I think that society should deal with abortions by treating them as legal, protected healthcare, provide safety to organizations that offer abortions, and promote stories of positivity that came from abortion. Abortions should be treated as legal, protected healthcare because when it comes down to it abortions are healthcare for uterus having individuals, and there should be safety for these organizations due to the sensitivity and backlash on the topic of abortions. Stories of positivity are important for this topic because most stories around abortion come from the negative side, such as rape, and you do not hear about the person who had an abortion because it wasn't the right time in their life for a child but was able to create a beautiful life for a future child.

question_text:
Part 3/3: Candidate Summaries

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we will condense the survey responses into a short summary. We will now present 5 candidate summaries to you, and your task is to rate to what extent they would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be allowed in the first trimester but restricted afterward unless there are exceptional circumstances. This policy respects a woman's right to choose while recognizing the increasing moral considerations as the pregnancy progresses. Society should invest in education and healthcare to prevent unwanted pregnancies and support women through their reproductive choices.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree that investments should be made in education and healthcare to prevent unwanted pregnancies. I disagree that abortion should be limited to the first trimester. Nothing would need to be added to fully represent my viewpoint.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal because it involves taking a human life, which I consider morally wrong. Society should focus on providing resources and support for pregnant women to encourage them to choose life. Adoption should be promoted as a viable alternative to abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I only agree with providing resources on adoption. I disagree that abortion should be illegal. They should add information about where they stand if an abortion is necessary to prevent maternal and fetal death, and the event of extreme birth defects.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible because women have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. Access to safe abortions is crucial for protecting women's health and well-being. Society should support comprehensive sex education and contraception to reduce the need for abortions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with supporting sex education and contraception usage. I do not disagree with this summary, and there is nothing to be added.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be restricted to certain circumstances, such as cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is at risk. This approach balances the rights of the unborn with the needs of women facing difficult situations. Society should provide support for women who carry their pregnancies to term, including healthcare and financial assistance.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree that there should be better support for women who carry their pregnancies. I disagree that abortion should be limited to rape, incest, or maternal death. I do not have anything to add to this summary.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be a personal decision between a woman and her doctor, without government interference. Each situation is unique, and women should have the autonomy to make the best choice for themselves and their families. Society should ensure that all women have access to affordable healthcare, including reproductive services.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree that women should have access to affordable healthcare, and that an abortion should be between the uterus having individual and their doctor. I do not disagree with this summary. I would add how the government could step away from abortion control.

question_text:
Thank you for completing the survey!

Click below to register your survey completion with Prolific and return to their website.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses. We will award a $1 bonus if your submission satisfies all minimum length requirements across all questions.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

question_text:
Thank you for completing the survey!

Click below to register your survey completion with Prolific and return to their website.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses. We will award a $1 bonus if your submission satisfies all minimum length requirements across all questions.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Part 1/3: Background Questions

We will begin by asking you 4 questions touching on specific parts of your opinion.

Background Questions

How often do think about abortion or discuss it with others? How does this topic make you feel?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I don't talk about abortion regularly but it does come up in conversation from time to time. I am most definitely against it as I believe it goes against the beliefs of the bible.

question_text:
Background Questions

Do you think abortion should be legal or illegal? Which circumstances does your answer depend on?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think abortion should be illegal. It is morally wrong to shed innocent blood according to the bible and I stand on those beliefs.

question_text:
Background Questions

Where do your beliefs about abortion come from? For example, did particular life experiences influence your beliefs?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I am a believer of Jesus Christ. As a believer, my beliefs are according to the Word of God. The bible is clearly against murder and abortion fits into this category.

question_text:
Background Questions

Can you describe a situation where you are not sure if abortion is appropriate or not? If so, what makes this situation borderline or unclear?

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: One area that is unclear in regards to abortion, are situations where there are complications in childbirth. If the mother's life is in danger due to complications, families have to decide whether to spare the life of the mother by terminating the child.

question_text:
Part 2/3: Your Position

This part only has one question. We will ask you to summarize, in three sentences, your overall position on abortion.

Your Position

Summarize your position on abortion in your own words. Please write how you think society should deal with abortions, and give reasons that support this policy.

Please write exactly 3 sentences: Be as precise as possible and prioritize the points that are most important to you. Your answer should be self-contained, which means that you can repeat things you already wrote as well as make new points.
text: I believe that abortion is immorally wrong. With the exception of a mother's life being endangered due to complications of childbirth, abortion should not be considered. There are other options that parents can take, such as adoption.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible to everyone, as it is essential healthcare. It is critical for women to have control over their own bodies and make decisions about abortion without government interference. Safe and legal access to abortion ensures that women can make the best choices for their health and well-being.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Abortion isn't just a procedure, and in this summary it focuses on the woman's right to have control of her body. But she is the one that decided to get pregnant, and an abortion as she knows ends the life of her child. So she already had control of her body and now doesn't want to be pregnant. She is responsible for her condition and now has another life to think about. She could just have easily used contraception that is covered by insurance and easy to get. So this summary promotes irresponsibility and demanding the right to get rid of the consequence which is the child. The whole premise would have to be changed for me to agree to it and it would have to be a complete reversal to state that its wrong to murder a child of any age, and taking a life isn't care of any kind and doesn't have anything to do with health.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should not be used as a form of birth control. However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree that abortion shouldn't be used as birth control. I also agree to a certain point that it should be allowed early on if the mother's life is in danger. I'm not sure about rape or incest and would probably just not want to legalize it for those cases. I also agree that people need to be educated about abortion and the consequences of promiscuous behavior. But I think people already do know this and choose to ignore the risks and just decide to have sex when they know the consequences. So I'm not sure how much of an impact education will make on poor decisions. But it is something I agree with and I think it helps reduce unwanted pregnancy. It would also be nice if it mentioned the support of life and that abortion is wrong because it is the murder of a child.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that women should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I don't agree with anything in this summary because it focuses too much on a woman and what she wants and ignores that the child she carries also has rights and is a living person. No one would agree that a parent could randomly decide to do away with one of their children who was 1 or 2 because they didn't want to be a parent and it interfered with their choice and their body. But before the child is born, that is the argument and its a very selfish one. It completely disregards the child she chose to create and then asks to allow her to murder that child for autonomy and selfishness. Its a ghastly premise and it would have to be completely rewritten for me to agree to it since it so completely devalues life and elevates self.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with everything in this summary and it matches how I feel about abortion and how children's lives need to be protected. But I do believe it should be allowed if a woman's life is in danger just because it doesn't make sense to not have that option as a last resort if it would save her life.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I don't agree with anything in this summary. Women already have control over their health and no one forces them to get pregnant under normal circumstances. It doesn't make sense that it implies that abortion should be able to be used as contraception because there are various methods of birth control that are inexpensive and are covered by insurance. I think its just an excuse to manipulate people's feelings to push for legalized abortion. So the summary would need to be completely redone and have a more positive view of life and not of abortion for me to agree with it.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

It is crucial for the decision to have an abortion to remain a healthcare decision between a woman and her doctor, free from political interference. Society should respect and uphold these rights to ensure women's autonomy and wellbeing.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I don't like the way the summary calls abortion a part of healthcare. Because generally when you are receiving care, it doesn't involve the murder of someone. Healthcare is meant to improve health and prolong life, not end it because its convenient; which is what an abortion does. Plus everyone has a right to decide what to do with their body, it has nothing to do with politics or interference in some way. Its just another false argument to push abortion. So it would need to be rewritten and focus on not doing harm to a child because that's wrong, and focus more on personal responsibility instead of looking for excuses to cover up someone's poor life choices.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: A woman already has the freedom to reproduce or not and the government isn't usually involved. Its just a way to appear oppressed so they can promote abortion and act like someone is taking away their choice. Its not really about choice which you already have, its about taking a life and pretending its about choice and healthcare. Its a pretty deceptive argument because you couldn't just come right out and say you support taking the life of an unborn child. So they go around the issue and don't really address it directly. I disagree with everything in the summary and it would need to be written to oppose abortion and support the life of a child so that it would represent what I think about abortion.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I don't agree that abortion should be legal at all except to save the life of the mother, so the summary would need to be changed to mention that for me to feel like it represents how I feel about it. I like that they agree that a fetus needs to be protected because most of the summaries don't even mention that a baby is involved. So I think this summary is more honest, but its still in support of abortion, which I don't agree with.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with everything in the summary and all the parts are things that I would include if I was writing about how I feel about abortion. I think if it made it more clear about when the person thought it should be allowed it would be better. Like if it mentioned abortion should be allowed if there is a medical emergency that endangers a woman's life, then I would also agree with that.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“In my opinion, abortion should be illegal except in cases where the mother's life is at risk or in instances of rape or incest. This stance protects unborn children while allowing necessary exceptions. It's about balancing moral concerns with compassion for those in difficult situations.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This summary captures my viewpoint well and I agree with most of what was said. But I don't really agree abortion should be allowed in cases of rape or incest. I think it should only be used as a last resort to save the life of a mother in an emergency. Otherwise I don't think it should be allowed at all and the life of the child needs to be protected and respected.

The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with just about everything stated here, but if I want to be nitpicky, I'll point out that not everyone who can become pregnant is a woman. I would also add that fewer abortions would need to be performed if we weren't so puritanical about sex education.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that a woman has the right to choose what she does with her body. It is crucial for the decision to have an abortion to remain a healthcare decision between a woman and her doctor, free from political interference. Society should respect and uphold these rights to ensure women's autonomy and wellbeing.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: The wording of this one bothers me a little. The only time a doctor should have a say in deciding whether or not someone has an abortion is if either option puts the patient at risk.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This is bad for a number of reasons. Firstly, I find the argument that abortion is murder to be bizarre. Is an egg a person too? A single sperm cell? If not, how does it suddenly become one when they're shoved together? Also, pardon my french here, BUT "PEOPLE SHOULD TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THEIR ACTIONS?" WHAT ABOUT RAPE??? Also, you wanna know what's REALLY irresponsible? Carrying a child to term when you know you don't want it, couldn't care for it, or it would have a poor quality of life.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Ironically, criminalizing abortion in all cases will lead to a lot of deaths. If it's illegal in ALL cases, that includes situations where both the mother AND THE CHILD would die. How does that help A N Y O N E? If you say "we need to value and protect all human life," doesn't that mean we should try our absolute hardest to save people from pregnancies that would  k i l l  them? For God's sake, at least be internally consistent with your argument.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Here is where I'll admit I don't have a fully realized opinion. I haven't given much thought to the permissibility of late-stage abortions. I do lean toward them being permissible though - I think the fear people have is that pregnant individuals will go around getting late abortions willy-nilly if allowed to, but a few moments of consideration is all it takes to realize that's stupid. Do you know how difficult pregnancies can be? I don't but I know it's not easy. No one is hopping at the idea of getting knocked up and waiting months on end to get their abortion. If someone makes the difficult decision to get an abortion late in the game, they probably have a pretty good reason for it. But again, I'm not confident about that answer.

text: Why are we considering a clump of cells with no memory, experience, or relationships to be people? Just because something can become a person does not mean it is a person. Props for remembering rape exists though.

Thank you for completing the survey!

Click below to register your survey completion with Prolific and return to their website.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

  3. be concrete and actionable.

text: It explains my views perfectly and succinctly. I agree with all of it: that abortion should be legal, it's a healthcare decision that should be decided between a woman and her doctor, and especially that it should not be a political issue. I don't disagree with any of it, and I believe it accurately represents my views to the point where I'd be comfortable giving this statement on the issue verbatim.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible to everyone, as it is essential healthcare. It is critical for women to have control over their own bodies and make decisions about abortion without government interference. Safe and legal access to abortion ensures that women can make the best choices for their health and well-being.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This statement captures my views but not the full breadth of my views on abortion. I agree that abortion should be legal and accessible and that it is essential/critical for women to be able to access this healthcare free of government influence. I don't disagree with any of it. In addition, I believe it shouldn't be a political issue and that it should be a private healthcare decision between a woman and her doctor.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This statement captures my views on abortion excellently. I agree that a woman should have the right to choose what happens with her body, that reproductive freedom is important, and abortions should be safe and accessible. I don't disagree with any of it; however, I also believe abortions should not be a political issue and be a private decision between a woman and her doctor.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“In my opinion, abortion should be illegal except in cases where the mother's life is at risk or in instances of rape or incest. This stance protects unborn children while allowing necessary exceptions. It's about balancing moral concerns with compassion for those in difficult situations.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I disagree with this statement entirely and it doesn't capture my views at all. I believe abortions should be legal if the life of the mother is at risk and in cases of rape or incest, but restricting abortions to just those circumstances is completely opposed to my views. Abortions are not performed on children; they're performed on things that will become children eventually and I believe if someone is okay with abortion in some circumstances their views are not internally consistent. It is also not a moral decision. Morals do not enter into it. The statement would have to be thrown out entirely for me to agree with it.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This statement captures my views very well. I agree that abortion should be legal and accessible at all states of pregnancy, because the vast majority happen before a fetus is even viable and if it happens later, there are likely serious medical complications. I also agree that restrictions are more likely to force women into unsafe abortions or other undesirable circumstances. If I had to change or add anything to this statement, it's that abortions should not be a political issue, they should be a private decision between a woman and her doctor free from government influence.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: This statement captures my views extremely well. I agree that women should have the right to make the decision about their bodies, free from any kind of judgement. I especially agree that abortions should be a private matter, safe, legal, and accessible. Anything else does not respect the autonomy and privacy of women. If I had to add something I would add that don't believe it should be a political issue at all.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I disagree with this statement entirely and do not agree with a single part. Abortion should be legal in all cases. It is not a moral issue and shouldn't be treated as such. As for "ending a potential life", "potential lives" are ended with male masturbation and female menstruation in the same way; it's a useless statement. The alternative solutions proposed should be available regardless but should not be seen as an answer to forcing a woman (or even a child in some cases) to carry a baby to term and give birth. It may develop into a human given time, but it isn't from the start.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should not be used as a form of birth control. However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree that abortion should be legal in cases where the mother's life is in danger and in cases of rape or incest. I also agree that there should be education efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies. However what I agree with ends there. And the last part; the "consequence" is that the woman does not have to carry a baby to term and give birth. There's no mystery about what abortion does or some other results, but people attach their personal morals to it to make it something more when it isn't. I believe abortion should be legal in all cases, free from societal or moral judgment, and should be a private decision between a woman and her doctor.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I don't agree with this statement at all. I believe it should be legal in all cases. I do not believe that abortion is a moral issue or equivalent to taking a life. I believe that where human life begins isn't as simple as saying it beings at conception. At that point it may develop into a human but it is not one yet and terminating a pregnancy happens before that development begins or is even definitely complete. When people say women should take responsibility for their actions, to me that means living with the circumstances even though they have the power to change them just because someone else doesn't agree (which isn't the way things work).

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I believe this statement comes from a place of understanding closer to where my own views on abortion come from, but it's built upon information that doesn't reflect the reality of the situation. Restricting abortion to somewhere in the first or second trimester is arbitrary. There's a "potential life" for the whole term of the pregnancy and I believe that's a useless metric. However, the fetus becomes viable late in the second trimester and even then that's not a life that's guaranteed to survive outside the mother. The vast majority of abortions happen well before that and if one happens the life of the mother is more than likely in danger. I believe abortion should be legal in all cases, free from societal or moral judgment, and should be a private decision between a woman and her doctor.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with the entire summary.  I do not disagree with anything.  I would like to add that in a "free" country, women should have the right to dictate what happens to their own bodies.

It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I disagree with the entire summary.  Personally, life does not start at conception, life starts technically when the baby is born.  In addition, abortion is never used as birth control in the first place.  This entire summary is incorrect.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I agree that abortion should be legal but I believe it should be legal in a grand majority of cases, not just for rape or incest.  What in this summary is an early timeframe??? I would want that part to be made clear.  I agree that there should be robust educational efforts made in society.  However, abortions will still be needed and women should have the right to choose.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do not think there should be a point where it is restricted, or at least not significantly. I do not think abortions are done lightly, so I feel it enough to leave it up to any given woman to decide for themselves.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This is basically what I think. There are too many reasons someone might have for wanting or needing an abortion and it should not be the government that decides what is a valid one. Also, at the end of the day it is their body, so they should have control over it.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I feel exactly the same. I value personal freedom in general, and this is no different. The government should not decided what is best for people to this extent.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that women should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: This is basically what I think. As with any other medical decision, it should be between a person and their doctor(s), and nobody else unless the person wants it that way. I would add that it works that way for virtually every other medical situation so why should this be any different?

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“In my opinion, abortion should be illegal except in cases where the mother's life is at risk or in instances of rape or incest. This stance protects unborn children while allowing necessary exceptions. It's about balancing moral concerns with compassion for those in difficult situations.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I fundamentally disagree with the ideas of this summary. I do not think "unborn children" can be considered children, thus I don't see any moral issue. On the other hand if I did think they were children and that it was immoral, it seems questionable to allow them to be killed. So if that were the case, "balancing moral concerns" would also be disagreeable to me.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with all of this. The part about accessibility is especially important, as people with troubling accessing something like that would probably also be in the worst position to deal with an unexpected pregnancy and/or complications.

question_text:

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I largely do not agree. The only thing I agree with is that abortion should generally not be a form of birth control, but mostly because that seems irresponsible when there are so many better options that can be done before you reach that point. I don't think life starts at conception so I don't think it is morally wrong.

question_text:

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I disagree with all of this. To begin with, I don't agree that it is equivalent to ending a potential life. On top of that, what if the life of the mother is at risk? How would those be weighed? I don't think it is at all reasonable to just always prioritize the unborn baby if that is the case, since to me the baby is essentially undefined at that point.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

text: I agree with a lot of this. Ultimately though, I don't think the government should be policing when it is reasonable to have an abortion. That will just result in women who need them not being able to get them. In general, more education would probably be good across the board though.

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with all of it, as the alternative would be women not being able to choose over their own bodies.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with everything. Especially the parts about reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

It is critical for women to have control over their own bodies and make decisions about abortion without government interference. How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with everything. I would add that not only should they be able to choose, but it should not be a point that politicians and people should oppose as it is none of their business.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I disagree with all of it. It should not be illegal, it is not murder and most women do not use it as a form of birth control

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I disagree with the viewpoint that there has to be contingencies. I would add that there should not be any reasons for them to be able to do it.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.
