Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: The viewpoint on the human rights of the unborn baby need to be addressed. Additionally, there is evidence that medical complications can occur from an abortion.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Generally what I believe to be true regarding abortion. This argument does a good job of addressing the moral and societal implications.

question_text:
Thank you for completing the survey!

Click below to register your survey completion with Prolific and return to their website.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I mostly do not agree with this summary. But I do agree that adoption needs to be reinforced more. Society should promote and advertise adoption services so that more mothers don't feel pressured to get abortions. And I do agree that pregnant women need more support, especially financially. But I feel like there are several cases where abortion is justifiable, such as rape, coercion, or first trimester abortions. Those need to be legal or women will have a very hard time. If the summary allowed for edge cases like these, I might be more inclined to support it.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible to everyone, as it is essential healthcare. It is critical for women to have control over their own bodies and make decisions about abortion without government interference. Safe and legal access to abortion ensures that women can make the best choices for their health and well-being.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think most of this summary is ok. I do believe abortion should not be restricted in most cases, as it is part of a woman's rights. But I don't think it should be accessible to EVERYONE, or we would see some bad events like third trimester abortions or frivolous abortions, which would be pretty close to murder in my opinion. If the summary clarified the accessibility, I might be more inclined to support it.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think women should try to be more responsible, but the tone in the summary is overly harsh to me. There are lots of rare circumstances, and abortion should be allowed there. And the "sanctity of life" is a very vague statement that could mean a lot. The summary should clarify that.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think the summary describes a lot of my views well. We need a middle ground, as the summary insists. I feel like early abortions should be legal since I don't think those count as "life" quite yet. But I do think more moderate medical reasons could justify abortion, and I don't think it should have to be severe to justify it. So the summary should clarify what they mean by severe medical reasons (painful? life-threatening? embarrassing?).

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that women should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do believe in the legality of abortion as the summary says. And I think they should not be stigmatized, as the summary claims. But I am not so laissez-faire about abortions as the summary claims. There are many cases where more aspects should be looked at, which should be specified in the summary.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: While I think women should be able to get abortions, I am not fan of late pregnancy abortions unless absolutely necessary. This summary seems to justify very late abortions, which I am totally against. Maybe the summary should mention what they mean by "all stages"?

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“In my opinion, abortion should be illegal except in cases where the mother's life is at risk or in instances of rape or incest. This stance protects unborn children while allowing necessary exceptions. It's about balancing moral concerns with compassion for those in difficult situations.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think this summary is in the right spirit with regards to protecting children, but I don't think abortions should only be for health related reasons. There are emotional reasons why early abortions might be needed, and the summary should mention whether those should be legal or not.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that a woman has the right to choose what she does with her body. It is crucial for the decision to have an abortion to remain a healthcare decision between a woman and her doctor, free from political interference. Society should respect and uphold these rights to ensure women's autonomy and wellbeing.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Most of the summary matches what I think, especially with regards to respect and personal rights. I do think abortion is needed sometimes, but I differ in that I think sometimes outsiders might have valid views on the decision. The summary should mention why it believes only a doctor and a woman should have access to the choice.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should not be used as a form of birth control. However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think the summary is right about limiting abortion somewhat. And I believe rape and incest are important exceptions, but I do think there are some cases where it could be used as birth control very early on. The summary could elaborate on that.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I support the right to choose, like in the summary, and women should be able to do what they want. But there should be some restrictions, which aren't mentioned in the summary. A revised summary could talk about long-term issues.

text: I think this is a good viewpoint. I'd want the language to be less gendered, as some trans people who do not identify as women would still require these. But that's not a dealbreaker either.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I think it's a misstep to say that women should be able to make decisions without government interference. There *should* be regulations to prevent doctors from forcing procedures onto people, and someone should not be free to make harmful decisions for their families.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. People should take responsibility for their actions and should never use abortion as a form of birth control.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do not support this viewpoint. It may be less harsh than others I've seen in real life, but it is still pretty bad. It doesn't matter whether abortion is morally right or wrong. I see it as neutral, but either way a person should be free to do what they want with their own body. "Responsibility" is a bad faith talking point, as it places the assumption that abortion is irresponsible or the result of irresponsibility on people who don't deserve that.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should not be used as a form of birth control. However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do not believe in any restrictions on abortion. It also is not really helpful to equate abortion to birth control, as that is an oversimplification of what it is used for. Additionally, "informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion" sounds a bit like a dogwhistle for anti-abortion advocates that like to try and scare/guilt women out of getting abortions.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: While it's admirable to balance moral concerns and compassion for others, this stance is terrible. Abortion being illegal under specific circumstances will result in women being harmed that this person isn't even thinking of. How would they prove it was rape, for example? Would abortions then be forced on women if it a pregnancy is the result of incest? This doesn't focus on women, it focuses on the person's selfish cultural views.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

  3. be concrete and actionable.

text: I completely agree with this. Anyone who can get pregnant deserves to make their own decision about what to do if they become pregnant. It is a matter of equality and healthcare access.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that women should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Again, I really agree with this because abortion is a personal health decision and should not be subject to government interference or societal shaming. I like that they touched on the societal aspect as well.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. It is morally wrong and equates to taking a life, as I believe in the sanctity of human life starting from conception. How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I fully disagree with basically every part of this. I don't think life begins at conception, but regardless, that is an abstract philosophical (and often religious) understanding that cannot dictate what other people do with their bodies. I also disagree that there is anything morally wrong with terminating a pregnancy. The notion that people use abortion "as a form of birth control" is unsupported and cruelly flippant about the circumstances that lead to abortions in many cases, and the women who utilize them. Also, getting an abortion may very well be the most responsible action that someone can take.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: Again, I agree. Abortion is crucial for women's (and other pregnant people's) wellbeing, health, and safety, and it should be protected by law.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I disagree that abortion is morally wrong. Adoption and support for pregnant women are great options, but they are not replacements for abortions. Adoption does not prevent a woman from experiencing a 9 month pregnancy that can threaten her life and/or irrevocably alter it.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I don't fully disagree with this take but I think it is important to note that late-term pregnancies do not happen except in some kind of extreme circumstance. This opinion feels a little bit like someone trying to be moderate by addressing a problem that doesn't really exist, and I worry that they would overcorrect and limit abortions in trying to achieve this "middle ground"

text: I certainly agree that abortion should be legal in cases of danger to life, rape, or incest. I also believe that abortion should be legal for any other reason that a woman may want to have one. Putting these limitations serve as paternalistic mechanisms of control over women. If you truly believe that life begins at conception and that abortion is murder, then it is not a sensical or moral approach to allow that "murder" based on the context of the fetus's conception. It is a disingenuous stance that allows people to feel moderate and moral while actually just serving to limit huge numbers of potential abortions.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I struggle between the moral rights of killing a CHILD and the mother having a choice. I do agree that abortions should be illegal for sure in the third trimester though.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I agree in full. However, it could list some circumstances when it is ok, such as sexual assault or woman's health

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and accessible to everyone, as it is essential healthcare. It is critical for women to have control over their own bodies and make decisions about abortion without government interference. How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I agree with everything. I also like that they specified it should be free.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I am staunchly pro choice. I strongly disagree with any kind of restriction on abortion.

Candidate Summaries

Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: While I am not very supportive of late term abortions, there are still reasons that they should be allowed. Some women don't know they are pregnant until well after the second trimester. I would like to know more about why this person thinks society should be able to dictate what someone does with their own body.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: Life does not begin at conception. I don't think the majority of people use abortion as a birth control. This summary reeks of assumptions and bias. “I believe that abortion should be illegal in most cases and only allowed under specific circumstances. How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I agree with the part about it being illegal in most cases. I also agree that it should not be used as a form of birth control. I agree that abortion should not be used as birth control and an excuse for poor responsibility. However, I disagree with the statement as a whole as I feel it should not be illegal. So, I get the gist and see where this person is coming from, but I don't agree and don't think they understand the aborter's point of view.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

text: I agree very much with the fact that it should be legal in cases of where the mother's life is in danger and with rape and incest. “I think abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy. Women need to have control over their reproductive health for various personal and medical reasons. Restrictions can force women into unsafe or undesirable circumstances.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do not think abortion should be legal during all stages of the pregnancy. The further along a woman is in her pregnancy, the more the baby has formed and can feel pain, and it's horrific to think about a baby being sucked into a vacuum and killed. I agree that for certain situations (life of the mother, rape, and incest), abortion should be legal to a point (the first trimester), but not after that.

The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I still think abortion is murder, so I don't think it should be legal in all circumstances. I do agree we should have safe and accessible abortion options for those scenarios though.

text: I agree very much with this viewpoint. I think the specific circumstances abortions should be allowed is in the case of rape, incest, or the mother's life being in danger. I do believe life begins at conception and that is why there should only be a small number of abortions allowed, but not to be abused as a form of birth control.

Thank you for completing the survey!

Click below to register your survey completion with Prolific and return to their website.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be legal up to a certain point in the pregnancy, such as the first or second trimester. After that, I think it needs to be restricted unless there are severe medical reasons. Society needs to find a middle ground that respects both a woman's right to choose and the potential life of the fetus.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I believe that this summary represents the stance the same way I would.  I don't think abortion should be done past a certain point of pregnancy unless abortion would save the mother's life.  I agree there needs to be a middle ground between a woman's right and the life of the fetus, but I ultimately feel it should be the woman's right to choose and that it shouldn't be dictated by anyone else.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I believe this summary captures my point of view on abortion sufficiently.  I agree that it should be a woman's right to choose what happens with her body and her life.  If a woman is clear enough to the make this decision that she is not ready for a child, that she cannot support a child, that her mental health is not stable for a child, for whatever reason really - I believe it has a ripple effect.  Forcing women to bear children when they know it isn't right for them can do more harm than good, especially for the child.  I believe that it shouldn't be used as regular birth control but definitely should always be an option.

question_text:

text: This summary doesn't capture my viewpoint on abortion because I do not agree abortion should be legal and accessible at all stages of pregnancy unless there is a medical reason the mother would need it.  I believe that it should be legal up to a certain point of the pregnancy but I definitely don't believe a 8 month old fetus should be able to be aborted.

text: I believe that this statement somewhat captures my viewpoint.  I do believe a woman's right to choose should be a private matter without societal judgement and that the procedure should be safe, legal, and accessible for the safety of both the mother and the fetus but I do believe there should be some regulation regarding how far along it is accessible unless there is a medical reason the mother needs it further along in the pregnancy.

text: This summary does not capture my viewpoint.  I do not believe that abortion should not be an option.  The pregnant woman should have support yes, but this society is not prepared to support the mother and child moving forward through life and the government shouldn't be able to completely decide the outcome of a woman's life by controlling their decisions regarding reproduction.  Forcing women into motherhood when they don't feel it's right for them just leads to negative impacts on the child's life.  Additionally I do believe that there are medical reasons it should be an option as well as situations where a woman who went through a trauma who shouldn't have to continue with a pregnancy because the law is forcing them to.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

text: I believe this summary adequately represents my viewpoint on abortion.  The only thing I would add is that there should be a cutoff point in the pregnancy where the mother shouldn't be able to have the abortion because the fetus has developed to a certain point.

text: This summary only captures a small portion of my viewpoint.  Yes, I believe medical necessity and a woman's trauma are factors that lend to the importance of accessible abortion but I also think a woman should be able to decide overall if she is prepared to be a mother for the sake of both the child and the mother.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

text: I do not feel this summary captures my viewpoint on abortion adequately.  While I feel abortion shouldn't be abused as regular birth control but I do believe it should be a woman's choice up to a certain point in the pregnancy.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: While I do believe there should be educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancy I still believe it should be permissible outside of the specified situations.  It should be a mother's decision up to a certain point if they are prepared to support a child and be a mother.

text:
The only part I agree with is "free from political interference". It's silly to say that abortion would be political.


I disagree with the fact that abortion should be legal. It should NOT. A woman doesn't have the right to choose what she does with her body, because it's now not ONLY her body. It's her body AND the other life that's inside of her body. We shouldn't have to ask for society to respect or uphold anything pertaining to abortion. When someone is murdered on the street, we don't ask society to respect the killer's decision to murder that person.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: Nope nope nope. A life is a life. There is no "certain point in the pregnancy", because the baby has a soul, a spirit, a body. When that sperm hits the egg, it's alive. Just because we can't see or feel it yet, doesn't mean it isn't there.

text: YES! Finally! Why are we supporting all the negatives and taking the easy route? To preserve motherhood and allow women to know that we love and support them regardless. We need more women and families who are willing to raise their children with all the help they can get. If we supported these families, they would stay families. We allow singles to freely have sex and not deal with the consequences of bearing another human life to their actions. If we take away that option, they would be more aware and proactive in taking care of their bodies and their life.

text:

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Instructions

In this survey, we want to hear about your opinions on abortion.

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should not be used as a form of birth control. However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree with almost all of this. Abortion should not be used as birth control, but should be legal in specific cases. I would add that it should be an option for a certain number of weeks for everyone (to young, can't support a child, or doesn't want a child), but after using it as an option once, it should no longer be available. Mistakes happen and I don't think anyone should be denied the choice the first time.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“Abortion should be illegal in all cases, as I believe it is morally wrong and equivalent to ending a potential life. Society should look for alternative solutions such as adoption and support for pregnant women. We need to value and protect all human life, starting from conception.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do not believe it should be illegal in all cases or that it is morally wrong. In the first few weeks, the fetus is not developed enough to be considered ending a life. I would say it is ending a potential start of a life. Adoption is not a valid alternative because some women's lives are at risk giving birth, or their uncomfortable with the idea of a child that is theirs being out there but not raised by them.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

Informed Consent

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

What will I need to do and how long will the study last?
We will ask you 10 questions. We expect that you will be in this research study for less than an hour.

Compensation
Your pay will not depend on your opinions: all good-faith responses will get fully compensated, so please just write what you think. You may not use ChatGPT or other AI tools to write or edit your responses.

Who will see your responses?
The data you provide will be immediately anonymized. We may later on publish this anonymous data. By continuing this survey, you agree to this use of your responses.

Who can I talk to?
If you have questions, concerns, complaints, or think the research has hurt you, you can contact the research team at gilirusak@g.harvard.edu.

However, it should be legally permissible in cases where the mother's life is in danger, and in instances of rape or incest within an early timeframe. Furthermore, there should be robust educational efforts to prevent unwanted pregnancies and ensure people are informed about the complexities and consequences of abortion.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: It is okay for emergency purposes when the mothers life is at risk

We are a team of university researchers. We want to understand in detail what people like you think about social questions, in this case about abortion. We want to study the diversity of people’s beliefs, and whether algorithmic tools can help summarize and analyze these differing points of view.

Instructions

To help researchers and policymakers understand public opinion on abortion, we condensed the responses of previous participants into 10 short summaries. We will now present each summary to you, and your task is to rate to what extent it would capture your point of view.

An ideal summary should

  1. perfectly capture all your thoughts and feelings on abortion,
  2. include the reasoning behind your opinion, and
  3. be concrete and actionable.

Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe abortion should be legal because it is a woman's right to choose what happens with her body. It is important for maintaining reproductive freedom and ensuring safe and accessible healthcare options. Women need to make decisions that are best for them and their families without government interference.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: While I do agree that a woman should have the choice of getting an abortion as a matter of reproductive freedom, I also believe that is it both the man and woman's responsibility to exercise proper safety when engaging in acts that could result in reproduction.

question_text:
Candidate Summaries

Here is a possible summary:

“I believe that abortion should be legal and that women should have the right to make decisions about their own bodies. The decision to have an abortion should be a private matter, free from societal judgment, as it's a crucial aspect of women's health and safety. Society should ensure that abortions are safe, legal, and accessible, respecting the individual's autonomy and privacy in making such decisions.”

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I agree it is a good part of a woman's health to have access to abortion if the pregnancy will negatively affect a woman's health, however I don't agree with a woman getting an abortion simply because she made bad choices, it should be a subject that is made widely public that both women and men share responsibility for procreating. The government shouldn't have full say in the private health of its citizens.

How well does this summary capture your viewpoint on abortion? Explain which parts you agree with, which parts you disagree with, and what would need to be added or made more concrete to fully represent your viewpoint.

(Please write two or more sentences.)
text: I do agree that women should have access to life saving abortion, I don't agree that other abortion should be made illegal, however people should fully grasp and understand the ramifications of getting an abortion as there will be people who will shun them for their carelessness regarding the creation and disposal of the unborn child.

text: I do agree that women having access to safe abortion practices is far better than the alternative of how women would conduct abortions prior to its legalization. text: This summary is not consistent with my viewpoint. Abortion should be legal throughout a pregnancy; I have read about women who needed an abortion in the third trimester because of severe health risks. The idea that women are having "optional" 3rd trimester abortions, and that doctors perform that, is ridiculous. This idea is used to disgust and manipulate people, and it is wrong.
